The claim is sourced from Republican pre: who stated that "Two-thirds of our kids can’t read at grade level" in a recent Medium post.
The claim is based on data from the Nati: NAEP), a federally sponsored standardized-testing effort.
The NAEP data for fourth: and eighth-grade students in 2015 shows that only 36 percent of fourth graders and 34 percent of eighth graders were categorized as proficient or advanced in reading.
However: experts caution that the term "proficient" used by NAEP does not necessarily equate to being "at grade level," as there is no universally accepted definition for what constitutes grade level performance.
